Produced the 1994 Smithsonian Folkways album 'Musical Traditions of St. Lucia, West Indies.' Also reachable at (758) 453-1477. Fax: (758) 451-9365. Email: frc@candw.lc. Hours: Mon-Fri 8:30am-4:30pm. name: Ken 'Scotty' Lawrence
description: Veteran Saint Lucian visual artist and painter. President of Artist Circle St. Lucia. Much admired and encouraged by the late Pat Charles. Exhibition at The Pyramid (Alliance Francaise) in March 2025, supported by PCEA and Alliance Francaise. Has contributed art to covers of numerous Saint Lucian publications. Works span many decades of Saint Lucian artistic output. Major painter whose work speaks to important aspects of being Saint Lucian, Caribbean, and human. Email: acstlicia@gmail.com

name: Cedric George
description: One of Saint Lucia's premier visual artists. Began drawing at age 4, serious painting at 21. Received UNESCO scholarship in 1985 to study art at Jamaica's Edna Manley College of the Visual and Performing Arts, graduating with honours and distinction. Served as Art Officer for Ministry of Education 1988-2004. Developed 'Organometrics' ‚Äî a distinctive technique combining organic and geometric elements with vibrant colors, textures, and parallel lines creating 3D illusions. Works in charcoal, watercolours, pencil, and oils. Painting hangs in the Bank of England Museum. Exhibited in UK, USA, Dominican Republic, Barbados, and Trinidad & Tobago. Mentored emerging artists including Rufus Darcie. Member of Artist Circle.
short_description: One of Saint Lucia's premier visual artists. Began drawing at age 4, serious painting at 21. Received UNESCO scholarship in 1985 to study art at Jamaica's Edna Manley College of the Visual and Perform

name: Gary Butte
description: Painter with over 20 years of experience. Known for 'Mask Parade' abstract paintings with thick tribal tones related to ancestral roots and spiritual themes. Also creates hand-painted bottles, watercolor sketches, and set designs for theatrical productions. Graduated from Sir Arthur Lewis Community College. First 'Mask Parade' Collection exhibited in 2011, toured Dominican Republic, Martinique, Grenada, Guadeloupe, and England. Represented Saint Lucia at CARIFESTA four times. Collaborated with Nobel laureate Derek Walcott on theatrical productions. Work featured in University of Nebraska's 'Prairie Schooner' and 'Caribbean Beat'. Facilitates national lantern festival. Best Creative Design Award 2003 at M&C Fine Arts. Member of Artist Circle.

name: Nicole Edgecombe Art
description: Intuitive self-taught artist and Clinical Psychologist. Specializes in acrylics and mixed media. Views art as a vehicle for healing ‚Äî transmuting fear into hope, pain into joy. Notable works include 'Strange Fruit', 'Piton Dream', 'Village Life', and 'Dauphin Spirit'. Serves as Public Relations Officer for Artist Circle St. Lucia. Advocates for 'Connecting Community Through Art'. Offers small group workshops. Member of Artist Circle.

Painter using various mediums including oils, acrylics, clay, wire, wax-resist, and found objects. Two years of art school at the Factory of Visual Arts (affiliate of University of Washington). Member of Artist Circle St. Lucia.

name: Alwyn St. Omer
description: Born 1958 in Castries. Son of the late Sir Dunstan St. Omer (designer of Saint Lucia's National Flag). Master draughtsman and colorist. Studied Art at Edna Manley School for the Visual Arts (Jamaica) and Video Production at Portsmouth College (England). Designed Saint Lucia's National Independence Monument. Known for 'Moon Dancer' Masquerade series. Specializes in paintings documenting Saint Lucian folklore, traditional carnival characters, and cultural heritage. Awarded Saint Lucia Medal of Honour, Gold (2021) and Catapult Caribbean Art Award (2020). Director of St. Omer Art Institute. Published in Sands Tourism Magazine, CIMPEX Home Companion, and Wakonte children's books. Also does murals ‚Äî restored the Faux-A-Chaud Mural. Caribbean Creative Network profile: caribbeancreativenetwork.org/profile/alwyn_st-omer
short_description: Born 1958 in Castries. Son of the late Sir Dunstan St. Omer (designer of Saint Lucia's National Flag). Master draughtsman and colorist. Studied Art at Edna Manley School for the Visual Arts (Jamaica)

name: Luigi St. Omer
description: Son of the late Sir Dunstan St. Omer. Taught art at St Mary's College for 20 years before retiring at age 40 to paint full time. Paintings displayed at Anse Chastanet Gallery, Alliance Francaise, and Orlando's restaurant in Soufriere. Known for swirling brush strokes creating energy and movement. Often features characters from Saint Lucia's carnivals and rural life. Explores and combines modern with traditional themes. Subject of a 2013 short film 'Luigi' by Jelani Paul exploring his painting process. Featured in CDF Emancipation Art Exhibition (2014).

name: Christopher Cox (Chris Cox Originals)
description: Dr. Christopher Anthony Cox, born 1967 in Toronto to Saint Lucian father and Jamaican mother, raised in Saint Lucia from age 5. Among the few recognized wildlife and environmental artists in the Caribbean. Works primarily in watercolour and acrylic capturing birds, reptiles, and forest environments. Joined St. Lucia Forestry Department 20+ years ago; fieldwork awakened his appreciation for wildlife. Featured in 'A Guide to the Birds of the West Indies' (Princeton University Press, 1998). Published in regional Caribbean Conservation Association bird poster series. Solo show at Alliance Francaise (2005). Inspired by Robert Bateman, Don R. Eckelberry, and Audubon. Shop: shopchriscoxoriginals.com. Email: chriscoxoriginals@gmail.com

name: Peter Walcott
description: Fine artist and son of Nobel Prize-winning poet and playwright Derek Walcott. Uses bright, light acrylic paint applied with controlled brush strokes, influenced by four years of formal architectural training at Boston University. Paintings filled with Saint Lucian imagery ‚Äî scenic landscapes and close-up foliage in vivid colour with architectural precision. 'Io√ºanalao' exhibition at Inner Gallery, Bois d'Orange featured island vistas (title refers to Saint Lucia's Amerindian name meaning 'where the iguana is found'). 'Lucian Landscapes' collection launched at Baywalk Mall.

name: Winston Branch OBE
description: Born 1947 in Castries, Saint Lucia. Moved to London at age 12, studied at the Slade School of Fine Art alongside David Hockney, Howard Hodgkin, and John Hoyland. OBE recipient. Early figurative works informed by Caribbean heritage transitioned to radical abstraction in late 1970s. Works in the collections of Tate Britain, British Museum, Brooklyn Museum, Victoria and Albert Museum, and Arts Council of Great Britain. Awards include British Council Award (1973), John Simon Guggenheim Fellowship (1978), and Albert Nelson Marquis Lifetime Achievement Award (2018). Featured in Sotheby's 'Journey into Light' and Christie's artist profiles. Represented by Cedric Bardawil Gallery (London).

Spacious, well-lit gallery providing professional viewing of local artworks. Features young (age 18+) and established Saint Lucian artists including Adjani John, Junette Alexander, Gilroy Hippolyte, Alcina Nolley, and Alwin Joseph. name: Chester B. Williams (Caribbean Colours)

Left in 1979 for business degree at Arizona State University, worked in banking in Downtown LA. A trip to Yosemite and seeing Ansel Adams' work inspired his photography career. Returned to Saint Lucia. Won many awards. Published in numerous books, magazines, and calendars locally and in the US/UK. Also published 'A Year in the Life of Saint Lucia' (Blurb). Member of Artist Circle.

Works include watercolors, assemblages, artist's books, installations, and silk scarves. Celebrated for themes of color and ornament. Exhibited in Swiss museums and recognized in contemporary Swiss art.

Based permanently in Saint-Tropez since 2001.

short_description: Dutch-Canadian artist who created ceramic tile paintings for Anse Chastanet Resort. Work designed and completed for specific settings at the resort, inspired by Saint Lucia's natural beauty.

name: Ron Savory (deceased 2019)
description: Guyanese artist who lived and painted in Saint Lucia in his later years until his death in 2019. Outstanding member of the second wave of Guyanese artists (1950s). Changed the concept of landscape painting in Guyana. Coordinated mounting of 36 art exhibitions for first Carifesta (1972). In Saint Lucia, continued painting flora and landscapes with his signature passion for light and colour. Work displayed at Anse Chastanet. Taught art at multiple institutions. Shows in Sussex, Dominica, Barbados, and Saint Lucia.

name: Jallim Eudovic
description: Master sculptor and son of famed Saint Lucian sculptor Vincent Joseph Eudovic. Known for minimalistic and conceptual wooden block sculptures embodying themes of uplift, perseverance, and community. Created government-commissioned public monument 'All In' for Castries waterfront. Work commissioned as gifts for Prince Harry, Prince Charles, PM of Norway, President of Mexico, and head of the UN. Erected seven monumental sculptures in Chinese cities. Exhibited at Miami (2019), Zari Gallery London (2016), 532 Gallery New York (2017). Received 2024 SUNSHINE Award for visual arts contribution.

name: Fiona Compton
description: London-based Saint Lucian artist, filmmaker, and historian. Daughter of John Compton, first PM of Saint Lucia. BA in Photography from London College of Printing (2005). Photographed influential figures in Finance and Banking for major UK publishers. Work explores disparities in Afro Caribbean representation. Award-winning filmmaker (Best Documentary, Best Director at Caribbean Film & Fashion Awards). Founded 'Know Your Caribbean' ‚Äî number one online platform for Caribbean history and culture. Featured in CDF Emancipation Art Exhibition (2014). Runs world's first 100% non-profit Carnival section.

name: Arnold Toulon

description: Saint Lucian artist born in Anse La Raye, living near Soufriere. Known for colourful painted ceramics, calabash, and acrylic on canvas. Subjects include the Pitons, coral reefs, birds, flowers, and countryside scenes. Painted decorative wall murals at Anse Chastanet's beach restaurant and bar, and created 'sky' ceiling murals in guest rooms. Work featured in the Anse Chastanet gallery. Deceased (lost during Hurricane Tomas).

name: Winston Fevrier (Melting Pot West Indian Studio)
description: Master wood carver and artist. Operates Melting Pot West Indian Studio, a gallery perched on a cliff overlooking Anse La Raye village. Specializes in hand-carved and hand-painted masks from native woods, word art, and custom carvings. Wide range of styles and prices. Known for genuine, high-quality handcrafted artwork. Highly rated on TripAdvisor.
short_description: Master wood carver and artist. Operates Melting Pot West Indian Studio, a gallery perched on a cliff overlooking Anse La Raye village. Specializes in hand-carved and hand-painted masks from native woo

name: Alcina Nolley (Courtyard Art Studio)
description: American-born artist and jewelry maker residing in Saint Lucia since 1992. BA from State University of Buffalo Teacher's College. Creates one-of-a-kind handmade jewelry (fine silver, sterling silver, precious and semiprecious gems), paintings, and crafts. Gallery at 7A Tradewinds Crescent, Coubaril, Castries. Offers one-day classes in metal clay and enameling. Art Clay Senior Instructor. Work reflects her love of Saint Lucia.

name: Lou Metzger
description: International artist known for panoramic landscape paintings. Work represented at Anse Chastanet Art Gallery in Soufriere alongside works by Stefan Szczesny, Claude Sandoz, and Elvira Bach.
short_description: International artist known for panoramic landscape paintings. Work represented at Anse Chastanet Art Gallery in Soufriere alongside works by Stefan Szczesny, Claude Sandoz, and Elvira Bach.

name: School of Art and Design Saint Lucia
description: Founded in 2005 by Signa Greaves-Francis. The only art and design institution in Saint Lucia, self-described as 'The Caribbean's Premiere Creative School'. Offers Certificate and Diploma Programs in Fine Arts, Fashion Design, Interior Design, Graphic Design, Web Design, Animation, and Photography. Also offers Summer Art Programs and professional workshops. Located along Marisule/Gros Islet highway.

name: Brian Toussaint
description: Saint Lucia-based artist who co-opened a gallery with Arnold Toulon at Bois d'Orange, Gros Islet. Part of the local art community exhibiting at galleries around the north of the island. Limited online presence.
short_description: Saint Lucia-based artist who co-opened a gallery with Arnold Toulon at Bois d'Orange, Gros Islet. Part of the local art community exhibiting at galleries around the north of the island. Limited online

name: Michele Elliot
description: Born in Saint Lucia, self-taught artist and accomplished restaurateur. Well-known painter and potter whose ceramics, paintings, and silk-screen prints are in demand. Hand-painted ceramic serving bowls, jugs, and vases inspired by Saint Lucian fruits and daily life. Brand name 'Wild Orchid Designs'. Operates The Pink Plantation ‚Äî a restored French colonial house that combines restaurant, guest house, and art gallery. Also runs The Coal Pot restaurant with her husband. Instagram following of 1,683+. Pieces sold at galleries and through The Pink Plantation.
short_description: Born in Saint Lucia, self-taught artist and accomplished restaurateur. Well-known painter and potter whose ceramics, paintings, and silk-screen prints are in demand. Hand-painted ceramic serving bowls

name: Joshua Pierre
description: Wood sculptor trained by master sculptor Vincent Joseph Eudovic from the age of five during summer vacations. After graduating high school, continued studying wood sculpting, training at the Choiseul handicraft centre and in Canada where he lived and worked for over 10 years. Upon returning to Saint Lucia, decided to continue following his passion. Creates beautiful handcrafted wood sculptures. Finds the medium 'very soothing and spiritually satisfying'. Can be found carving daily at Eudovic Art Studio workshop. Visitors welcome to chat and purchase work. Contact through Eudovic Art Studio: +1758-452-2747.
short_description: Wood sculptor trained by master sculptor Vincent Joseph Eudovic from the age of five during summer vacations. After graduating high school, continued studying wood sculpting, training at the Choiseul

name: Urmie Persaud (Caribic Design)
description: Ceramic and textile artist. Pioneer of Saint Lucia's local craft business with Caribic Design ‚Äî one of the island's earliest craft businesses championing handmade local products when hotel shops and government had not yet recognized their value. Creates handmade pottery decorated in her unique style, with affordable prices from about US$5. In 2015, after retiring from teaching, created 'Live Mindfully Clothing' upcycled clothing line. Featured in MeCurator's Koul√® exhibition alongside Arnold Toulon, Peter Walcott, and other established and emerging artists.

name: Peter Charlemagne
description: Local Saint Lucian artist who created colourful wall murals, painted 'sky ceilings', 'flower boards', and impressive carved wall plaques and wooden sculptures at Anse Chastanet Resort. Collaborated extensively with the resort alongside the late Matthew Paul. Work featured at the Anse Chastanet Art Gallery. Primarily a muralist and decorative painter combining painting with carved woodwork.

name: Rufus Darcie
description: Emerging Saint Lucian painter mentored by veteran artist Cedric George during community workshops for school-leavers organized through the Ministry of Education. George served as Art Officer for the Ministry (1988-2004) and worked in the community to help young people hone their art skills through workshops he organized. Darcie is among the artists trained and nurtured during that period.

name: Tihara Smith
description: London-based designer and textile artist of Saint Lucian heritage. King's Foundation 35 Under 35. Inspired by the Windrush Generation and Caribbean heritage. Graduated from University for the Creative Arts Epsom (2018). Graduate collection inspired by Windrush story acquired by The Museum of London. Won Start Up With Seven Dials competition (2021) for pop-up shop on Neal Street, London. Deeply inspired by traditional Saint Lucian straw embroidered crafts from Choiseul. Creates art prints and fashion referencing Saint Lucia Pitons and island life. Granddad Lazare Sylvestre born and raised in Vieux Fort, came to London in 1958 as part of the Windrush generation.
short_description: London-based designer and textile artist of Saint Lucian heritage. King's Foundation 35 Under 35. Inspired by the Windrush Generation and Caribbean heritage. Graduated from University for the Creative

name: Sarah Joseph
description: Caribbean fine art acrylic painter currently based in the UK with ancestral connections to Saint Lucia. Launched solo show 'Resonance' at The Inner Gallery Building, Bois d'Orange, Saint Lucia (2015). Paintings inspired by her first visit to Saint Lucia and powerful feeling of ancestral familiarity and connection. Preferred medium is acrylic on canvas. Known for vibrant depictions of Caribbean Carnival, festivals, and cultural celebrations. Work sold through The Inner Gallery in Saint Lucia.
short_description: Caribbean fine art acrylic painter currently based in the UK with ancestral connections to Saint Lucia. Launched solo show 'Resonance' at The Inner Gallery Building, Bois d'Orange, Saint Lucia (2015).

name: Nadia Huggins
description: Self-taught photographer and graphic designer born 1984 in Port of Spain, Trinidad. Has lived and worked in Saint Lucia and Saint Vincent and the Grenadines. Combines conceptual and documentary photography focusing on belonging, place, identity and memory. Main preoccupation with the sea ‚Äî uses own body, ocean, and marine organisms to explore identity. Co-founded ARC Magazine (2011), the visual arts publication for Caribbean and Diaspora artists. Won Festival Caribeen de L'Image du Memorial ACTe Jury Prize, Guadeloupe (2015). Exhibited regionally and internationally. Featured on the HeadPhunk creative stage in Saint Lucia.
short_description: Self-taught photographer and graphic designer born 1984 in Port of Spain, Trinidad. Has lived and worked in Saint Lucia and Saint Vincent and the Grenadines. Combines conceptual and documentary photog

name: Irene (Choiseul Potter)
description: Traditional potter from Choiseul alongside Mary Leo. Featured at the Choiseul Arts and Crafts Centre. Practises indigenous open-fired pottery techniques passed down through generations of women in the Choiseul area. Creates traditional items including coal pots and canawi cooking pots using locally-sourced clay.

name: Tsai Min Han
description: Renowned Taiwanese master sculptor who facilitated the Cultural Development Foundation's 'Artistic Renaissance: Rebirth of Humanism, Perspective, and Depth in Art' wood sculpting workshop in Saint Lucia (October 2024). The 4-week training programme (1 week virtual, 3 weeks in-person) transferred essential sculpting techniques to aspiring and practising Saint Lucian sculptors through an intercultural exchange. Participant works were exhibited at the Taiwan/Saint Lucia Trade Show 2024 and Art and the City 2025.
short_description: Renowned Taiwanese master sculptor who facilitated the Cultural Development Foundation's 'Artistic Renaissance: Rebirth of Humanism, Perspective, and Depth in Art' wood sculpting workshop in Saint Luc

name: Simon Gajadhar (Zaka)
description: Born in London, came to Saint Lucia in 1993. Famous for his signature Crayola-bright masks and fanciful sculptures. Ran Zaka Art Cafe in Soufriere serving homegrown coffee alongside art displays. Works also featured at Anse Chastanet Gallery. Passed away in 2024. His cafe has closed but one of his former artists continues painting Zaka-style masks, which can be found at Adeline's Art Cafe near Canaries and other shops around the island. Legacy of distinctive Caribbean mask art lives on through apprentices.
